The government has rules about how long kids can work, too. For example, on school days, they might only be able to work up to 3 hours, while on weekends or holidays, they could work up to 8 hours. These rules make sure children have time for school, rest, and fun. It’s a good idea to check child labor laws in your area since they might be a little different depending on where you live. Have them work with people you know. Have a trusted adult nearby. Another important point is making sure the child knows they can always turn to their guardian or parent for help without feeling embarrassed or afraid. You want them to feel comfortable and open, knowing they can share anything that comes up along the way. Remember to set clear expectations with parents about duties and pay rates. Most 11-year-old babysitters charge around $5 to $10 per hour. Babysitting can be an ideal first job for your child, especially if they have younger siblings or cousins to practice with under your supervision. It’s a great way to gain experience if they want to work with animals when older. I recommend that kids start by offering their services to family friends or neighbors. They might feel more comfortable letting a child watch their pets since they know them. 3.
